DataElement.preferredName: Computed Tomography Ultrasound Imaging Magnetic Resonance Imaging Diagnostic Imaging Liver Outcome Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type related to result of the diagnostic imaging of either a method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis or a technique in which high-frequency sound waves are bounced off internal organs and the echo pattern is converted into a 2 dimensional picture of the structures beneath the transducer or imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues for the large organ located in the upper abdomen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Computed Tomography Ultrasound Imaging Magnetic Resonance Imaging Diagnostic Imaging Liver Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to result of the diagnostic imaging of either a method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis or a technique in which high-frequency sound waves are bounced off internal organs and the echo pattern is converted into a 2 dimensional picture of the structures beneath the transducer or imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues for the large organ located in the upper abdomen.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Computed Tomography Ultrasound Imaging Magnetic Resonance Imaging Diagnostic Imaging
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis. :A technique in which high-frequency sound waves are bounced off internal organs and the echo pattern is converted into a 2 dimensional picture of the structures beneath the transducer.:Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders. :Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..

Concepts.definition: A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.
The use of high-frequency sound waves to generate images of the body.

Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.
Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.

Property.preferredDefinition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the outcome of a computed tomography diagnostic procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
